name: Prefer using indexes instead of subscripts
description: This rule searches for Cobol Programs that access internal tables with a subscript rather than an index.
output:
This rule lists Cobol Programs that access internal tables with a subscript rather than an index. 
It provides the following information: 
- Cobol Program full name 
- Number of violations 

It also provides bookmarks for violation patterns found in source code: 
- Access done using a subscript 
- Internal table
rationale:
Using indexes to address a table is more efficient than using subscripts since the index already 
         contains the displacement from the start of the table and does not have to be calculated at run-time. Subscripts, 
         on the other hand, contain an occurrence number that must be converted to a displacement value at run-time before 
         it can be used.
reference: IBM Cobol - Best Practices and Recommendations
remediation: Prefer to use index rather than subscript. Add an INDEXED clause in table definition and use this index.
remediationSample:
01 DIRECT-TAX-RATE. 
02 TAX-RATE PIC 99 OCCURS 5 TIMES INDEXED BY TX-INDEX. 
... 
SET TX-INDEX TO 4. 
MOVE TAX-RATE(TX-INDEX) TO SEC-RATE.
sample:
01 DIRECT-TAX-RATE. 
02 TAX-RATE PIC 99 OCCURS 5 TIMES. 
01 TX-IND PIC S9(8) COMP. 
... 
MOVE 4 TO TX-IND. 
MOVE TAX-RATE(TX-IND) TO SEC-RATE. 
...
